prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** *Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties:* - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3, 0.0] *Now, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. This sketch will consist of one face with a single loop, made up of four lines:* - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.45] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.45] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.0] *Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75.* *Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system.* - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3, 0.0] *Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties:* - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.3 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.75 **Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Slightly Tapered Top and Bottom** *Create a new coordinate system with the following properties:* - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.15, 0.0, 0.225] *Now, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. This sketch will consist of two faces, each with a single loop, made up of an arc and a line:* *Face 1:* - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.225], Mid Point [0.225, 0.0], End Point [0.45, 0.225] - Line 1: Start Point [0.45, 0.225], End Point [0.0, 0.225] *Face 2:* - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.225], Mid Point [0.225, 0.45], End Point [0.45, 0.225] - Line 1: Start Point [0.45, 0.225], End Point [0.0, 0.225] *Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.45.* *Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system.* - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.15, 0.0, 0.225] *Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties:* - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.0 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.3 - Sketch Scale: 0.45 *Perform a cut operation with the current part and the preceding CAD model.* The resulting final shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular, metallic object with a pointed tip and a curved base. The rectangular prism from Part 1 forms the base of the object, while Part 2 is a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, sitting on top of the base. The height, width, and length of each intermediate part and the final shape are as follows: - Part 1: Length 0.75, Width 0.3, Height 0.75 - Part 2: Length 0.45, Width 0.3, Height 0.45 - Final Shape: Length ~1.2, Width ~0.3, Height ~1.15</description>
